title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: The north and east walls of the chapel are almost entirely occupied with a series of tablets recording the gifts of numerous benefactors. The earliest of these is probably a daughter of the founder, " Isobel Macquhane, spous to Gilb' Lauder, merchant burgess of Edinr, who bigged ye crose house, and mortified df?50 yearly out of the Cousland, anno 1555." Another records, that " John Spens, burgess of Edinburgh, bestowed 100 lods of Wesland lime for building the stipel of this chapell, anno 1621."
